description:
Collects Issues 1-6

Note: The collected edition did NOT keep the first two pages colored from issue #1.
name: TPB

description:
Manga Contents

  • Omezame Please

The Pistolwhip boys are back with the highly anticipated and thrilling new narrative that's really going to make your Pistolwhip machine hum! Jack Peril is the beloved hero of radio, comics, and the silver-screen, but is his existence merely fictional? What does a series of grisly murders and a new lecture series condemning the pulse-pounding parables of said Mr. Peril have to do with it all? And just who is The Yellow Menace? Mitch and Charlie, along with Ray (the luckless cop) and Isla (the inquisitive maid), plan to find out in this clever (and probably first ever) parody of "Seduction of the Innocent"!
name: Volume 2

person_credits.name: Peter Bagge
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: Dilbert has become the hero of office workers everywhere, and his popularity continues to grow. With his sarcastic, power-hungry sidekick, Dogbert, Dilbert provides a humorous outlook on one of life's most insidious subjects: work. Each hilarious postcard in this book of 30 is guaranteed to be torn out and placed in mailboxes (or on cubicle walls everywhere).

person_credits.name: Scott Adams
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

volume.name: The Family Upstairs, Introducing Krazy Kat

person_credits.name: Charles M. Schulz
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

person_credits.name: Garry Trudeau
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

volume.name: But This War Had Such Promise

description: An unsanctioned hit goes bad, and our heroes are faced with an ever-escalating situation. Crazed albinos, deep space hillbillies and MECH-powered mystery men abound!
name: Very Bad Things

description: As Silverfawn embarks on a mission to aid the Elves of the Enchanted Forest against invading Goblin forces, she finds enroute a dark persona from her past, the mysterious Lord Tylos. Is he friend or is he foe?
name: Enter Lord Tylos

description: The first story arc comes to a semi-close. Silverfawn's suppressed rage crescendos as she and her allies face off against Bonecrack and his goblin soldiers. Longing for outright vengeance, Silverfawn refuses to stop until every single goblin is dead, including Bonecrack himself! Relations continue to develop and mysteries continue to unfold.
name: Death To the Goblins

description: Turning towards the famed Golden Warrior of Drohm, Lord Dominic. He's having a difficult time with the hurt he inflicted upon Silverfawn. He is offered a chance by the enigmatic Mystiq to redeem himself, but at what cost? And as the kingdom of Drohm prepares to wage war on a neighboring empire, does Dominic have the heart to lead troops into battle? And can he kill again?
name: Redemption

description: Dominic's chosen path leads toward disaster as he entrusts a mysterious stranger to help him bring back Silverfawn's deceased Elven son. Meanwhile, the shadow-borne agent of the Fahadin, given a mission to assassinate the young Prince Finn, worms his way into Thraldor, as Empress Sandra musters her Drohm forces and plans a daring attack on the kingdom of Carahill. But Carahill, privy to Drohm's aggression, has its own plans as we are introduced the powerful Lady Falla.
name: Introduction To A Lady

description: Prince Finn learns the truth about his father and finds himself under the manipulations of Zarcon. Dominic decides to lead the troops while Lady Falla plots with Zarcon to undercut the Drohm empire.
name: Quest For Empire

description: "The Stars of Ingaar!" Written by Jean Léturgie and Xavier Fauche. Art by Phillipe Luguy. The evil Baron Deadstone has stolen three mystical gemstones that will make him invincible. Only Percevan, brave knight and servant of the king, can stop him. But to do so he will have to travel to the frozen lands across the sea and risk many dangers. Fortunately, he has the assistance of a powerful sorceress! This volume collects "The Three Stars of Ingaar," "The Tomb of Ice," and "The Sword of Ganael" and presents these stories in English for the first time!
name: The Scars Of Ingaar

description: "The Realm of Aslor!" Written by Jean Léturgie and Xavier Fauche. Art by Phillipe Luguy. Percevan's adventures have taken him to the frozen north and pitted him against supernatural foes, but have these experiences prepared him for his next trials? In each of these three stories, Percevan finds himself fighting to save a beautiful woman... but which of these women are damsels in distress, and which are dangerous foes in their own right? This volume of the Legends of Percevan collects three stories: "The Realm of Aslor," "The Hourglass of El-Jerada," and "The Black Arcantane." Translated by Kurt McClung.
name: The Realm Of Aslor

description: "The Shadow of Malicorne!" Written by Jean Léturgie and Xavier Fauche. Art by Phillipe Luguy. Percevan is a brave and noble knight in the service of the king. In his adventures he has made many friends and many enemies. He has treated with powerful wizards, rescued a beautiful sorceress, and been the salvation of an entire kingdom. Now an ancient magic has been reawakened, and Percevan shall be one of its first victims! In order to save him, his trusted companions, and others whose loyalty is less certain, must unravel long-lost magical secrets and defeat warriors who cannot be killed. Such is the legend of Percevan. This volume of the Legends of Percevan collects three stories: The Keys of Fire, The Infernal Knights, and The Emerald Table.
name: The Shadow Of Malicorne

description: "The Seven Seals!" Written by Jean Léturgie and Xavier Fauche. Art by Phillipe Luguy. Although no longer in service to his king, Percevan remains committed to the ideals of knighthood. He will travel to the desert sands to defend the innocent and risk everything to protect the world...and everything is, indeed, on the line as an old enemy threatens to bring about the Apocalypse! Even with the assistance of powerful magical allies, does Percevan stand a chance against the Four Horsemen? The redhaired knight won't be coming through this adventure unscathed, but such is the legend of Percevan. This volume of the Legends of Percevan collects three stories: The Master of Stars, The Seals of the Apocalypse, and The Seventh Seal.
name: The Seven Seals

description:
Cover: Fay Dalton (American Reaper)

  • Judge Dredd - Shotgun (Michael Carroll - John Burns)
  • Interview - Paul Marshall
  • The Streets of Dan Francisco (part 1) (Arthur Wyatt - Paul Marshall)
  • American Reaper II (part 4) (Pat Mills - Clint Langley)
  • American Reaper: Reaper Files - Tipping Point (Pat Mills - Fay Dalton)
  • Bob Byrne's Twisted Tales (Bob Byrne)
  • Judge Dredd - Going Wheely (part 2) (illustrated text story) (T.C.Eglington - Julian Gibson - reprinting his Dredd cover from 2000AD prog 1059)
  • Insurrection III (part 2) (Dan Abnett - Colin Macneil)

Graphic Novel 61 - Downlode Tales (volume three) (Cover: Simon Davis)

  • Downlode Tales - Lock and Lode (parts 6 to 8 - reprint from 2000AD progs 1166-1168) (Dan Abnett - Simon Davis)
  • Sinister Dexter - The Off-Lode Experience (complete - parts 1 to 9 - reprint from 2000AD progs 1313-1321) (Dan Abnett - Simon Davis)
name: Meg 335

description: Transformers Animated: The Cool is a Japanese comic (Manga) written and drawn by Naoto Tsushima. It was serialized in Kerokero Ace. The Cool acted as a loose adaptation of Transformers: Animated cartoon.
name: TPB

volume.name: Transformers Animated: The Cool - Special Edition

description: Finally, the collection all Sergio fans and horror fanatics have been howling for -- the Boogeyman trade paperback! Collecting the four issue series by Eisner-award winner Sergio Aragonés, this book is a guaranteed scream. Follow Mr. Diggs, through his graveyard reverie of macabre horrors and blackest hatred. If you missed the series, then be sure to catch the collection -- we're dying for you to see it!
name: TPB

description: Winner in 1997 of Ruben, Eisner, and Harvey Awards, and widely regarded as one of the greatest living cartoonists, Sergio Aragonés proves again that a picture paints a thousand words, and a one-page strip is good for a million laughs! If you don't know Sergio Aragonés's unique brand of humor, join the millions of readers who have for decades enjoyed his silent but deadly jibes at society. And if you grew up on it, take a look at his latest work, and remember what it feels like to laugh out loud!
name: TPB

volume.name: Super Lifeform Transformers: Beast Wars Neo

deck: Sneak peeks into six must-have graphic novels!
description:
This free sampler consists of six previews to the following six graphic novels, all featuring female characters, written and illustrated by various talents (story/art):

  • Burnout (Rebecca Donner/Inaki Miranda)
  • Water Baby (Ross Campbell)
  • The New York Four (Brian Wood/Ryan Kelly)
  • Janes in Love (Cecil Castellucci/Jim Rugg)
  • Emiko Superstar (Mariko Tamaki/Steve Rolston)
  • Token (Alisa Kwitney/Joëlle Jones)

Note: The cover is a collage of various lead characters.
name: 2008 Sampler

volume.name: World's Best Comics: Golden Age DC Archives Sampler
World's Best Comics: Silver Age DC Archives Sampler

description: Captain America and Iron Man head to Madripoor for a technology expo! What could possibly go wrong? Everything, that's what, especially when Batroc's Brigade shows up and a technological nightmare threatens to bring the world to its knees. As technology goes berserk all around them, Captain America and Tony Stark fight their way through Madripoor in search of the villains behind the disaster. Collecting: Captain America 633-635, 635.1
name: TPB

description: If you think you know American history, think again! The follow-up to the New York Times-bestseller, Empire of the Rising Dead, FUBAR: American History Z is a stand-alone anthology that covers the entire American experience. From the discovery of the New World to present day, this volume shows what happened when our founding fathers came face to face with the walking dead.
name: American History Z

description: Something's rotten in the San Andres Mountains ... and it's eating the locals. Captain America and Hawkeye investigate, but all the patriotism and arrows in the world may not be enough to save the two Avengers from a hive of dino-monstrosities. And as the hidden city's secrets begin to unravel, Cap 'goes Mesozoic' - and sets his newly carnivorous sights on Hawkeye. The Hybrid Queen awakens - in a big way - and only Cap, Hawkeye, and Stegron the Dinosaur Man (?!) stand in her way. Collecting: Captain America and 629-632
name: TPB
